segments.text: The woman continues to dry her plate, utterly oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't felt the water on her foot yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is growing larger, reflecting the dim light of the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so absorbed in her task, her attention fixed solely on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a stark contrast to the lively, if dangerous, activity behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so present in one moment and so absent in another?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it a little frustrating that she's missing so much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The calm exterior of the garden through the window further highlights the domestic chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It really makes you wonder what else people miss in their daily routines.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Thereâ€™s a certain tragic humor in her focused unawareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so peaceful, yet her kitchen is in the midst of a silent cascade.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout and warn her about the water and the children.
segments.speaker: PAR
